titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rose Pastor Stokes letter to Benjamin Butler Davenport, 1914 August 6 RL.11149
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-02-26 11:47:16 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Rose Pastor Stokes letter to Benjamin Butler Davenport
did.abstract: Collection comprises a letter Stokes wrote to dramatist Benjamin Butler Davenport regarding her plan to attend his play "The Silent Assertion" with her husband. Includes enclosure.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Rose Harriet Pastor Stokes (July 18, 1879 â€“ June 20, 1933) was an American socialist activist, writer, birth control advocate, and feminist.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Rose Pastor Stokes letter to Benjamin Butler Davenport was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Rose Pastor Stokes letter to Benjamin Butler Davenport, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2015-0050-LUBMSS470

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a letter Stokes wrote to dramatist Benjamin Butler Davenport regarding her plan to attend his play "The Silent Assertion" with her husband. Includes enclosure.
